Glossary: A seperate system which increases unit max level and combo count based on additional shards used (Also unlocks further jobs)
Used for limit breaks. Collecting enough soul shards allows you to transmute the corresponding unit.
A job upgrade that replaces one of the unit's current jobs
[Job Change] A job upgrade for a specific unit
[Job Change] A generic job upgrade for a group of units
Leveling a job to level 11 and fully equipping that level. Adds [Job Master Bonus]
Small percentage of bonus stats added upon Job Mastering. These are carried over to other jobs.
An attack that randomly occurs when near ally units. Each additional unit in the combo increases the attack power by 50%. Cannot miss (Can be Avoided)
Extra stage that extends above the normal events. Generally includes Materials Drops for Job Changes or Gears
A harder version of the Extra stage
Extended collaboration with Dragon Genesis. Units released are referenced as DG# with # being the chronology they were released
An ability that certain units have access to given that that gear is equipped. Also Gear Ability (GA)
To do a large amount of damage in one turn.
A unit's vital power. At 0 HP, a unit will get knocked out.
Increases power of magic attacks against target
Influences attack power (for missile / projectile based jobs) and hit rate
Determines the rate of units getting their turns (Higher AGI increases rate CT is gained)
Charge time is used to determine when will the unit get their turn, at 100 CT, a unit will get their turn and will be able to act. (Not to be confused with cast time)
Spell with cast time require time before casting. (Not to be confused with Charge Time.)
Amount of additonal damage when inflicting a critical hit
Luck based stat, used as a stat for damage for specfic skills
Range of a units Vertical Movement
Range of a units Lateral Movement
Affects the rate a unit will cause [Miss] to incoming attacks [Can be added from Leader Skills / Passive]
Available only in the form of Reactive, Fixed chance to [Avoid] an attack. (Attack with Sure-Hit property can still be [Avoided])
An effect on a unit that affects them positively.
An effect on a unit that affects them negatively.
A modification of a unit's state. [See Status Aliment Category]
Effects that prevent the use of abilities and actions
Prevent negative status ailments on affected unit for a certain amount of turns, also cures existing status aliments
Unable to move or act. Effect ends when attacked.
Regain certain percentage of HP every turn.
Regain certain amount of Jewel every turn. (Amount based on skill or items)
2 turn tick down for a unit; when the timer reaches zero, the unit is instantly defeated.
Deal percentage HP damage to affected target unit. (The percentage can be increased using some passive.)
Decrease accuracy and dodge of a unit.
PATK UP and PDEF DOWN, Automatically attack nearby enemy.
Affected unit will only attack the one that inflicted the status effect.
Affected unit will normal attack ally unit. Effect ends when attacked. (They will not attack allies that are charmed.)
Affected unit will be unable to act or move indefinitely until cured.
Disable reactive and interrupt casting. (If the stun lasts more than 1 turn, it stops the unit from acting)
Affected unit has a chance of being unable to perform actions and move. Also reduces chances of reactive occurring
Set the move of the affected unit to 1
Prevent movement of affected unit. (Can use skill.)
Prevent normal attack and usage of skills that will deal damage to the enemy. (Heals/Buff/Debuff that deal no damage can be used.)
Prevents using skills and disable reactive. (Can still normal attack)
Prevents the generation of CT for certain amount of time, also disable Reactive and Dodge on the Unit. (Lasts 35 Unit Time)
Decrease the generation of CT by 50% for a certain amount of time, affects casting (Lasts 35 Unit Time)
Increase the generation of CT by 50% for a certain amount of time, affects casting (Lasts 35 Unit Time)
Grants the target 1000 CT (an instant turn but keeping previous CT)
Unit is unable to drop below 1 HP for the duration (certain passives and gear have a chance at activating Guts)
FAQ: FAQ
Fate
Build Guide
Do Yomi [F/SN], Lamia [F/SN], or Zahar [F/SN] have weapons?
Why don't I see Kuon, Strauss, Richie, or a few others on this list?

No, but they can equip any weapons that fall into their job-types. Rider - Dagger, Caster - Staff
Saber - Sword, Assassin - Katana, Archer - Twin Swords, Berserker - Nothing, Lancer - Lance

Only units that can go up to 5★ in the current state of the game
are included. Any units that gain this ability later will be added then. There are
also a number of units under 3★ s that I just don't recommend leveling
under any circumstances.
Is Gilgamesh's weapon important?

It is not as important to Gilgamesh as other weapons are to their respective characters.  The PATK
is good, but there are a lot of cases where you'll want different accessories like HP or Resistances. If you 
really desire his Weapon Ability animation, you only need to bring your Gate of 
Babylon (weapon) to 3* to use it. This will change if Global gets the ability to double equip accessories.
In this case, you'll want to for sure have Gilgamesh's weapon as one of his gear equips, as it helps
increase his PATK.
Why do Tyrfing and Chloe have Holy Knight as their sub instead of Holy Cavalier?

So, interestingly enough, Holy Knight has a stronger sub skillset than Holy Cavalier. 
Holy Knight's Shield Smash has a 130% multiplier, while Holy Cavalier's Shield 
Bash has a 90% multiplier. For the other two skills, they lower PATK and PDEF, but with Holy 
Knight, at level 20, it lowers the stat by 25%, but with Holy Cavalier, it only lowers it by 20%
Gameplay
Who should I get with my 4* selector ticket?

Because all the units on the 4* selector ticket are farmable, your first priority should be to pick someone
you don't have. A duplicate will net you 20 shards, but to actually transmute the unit will take 80 shards.
After considering this, the recommended pool to pick from is Rahu, Lucian, Lofia, Reagan, Zangetsu.
The latter two will need a bit of farming (J2 Reagan, J3 Zangetsu) to become usable.
Should I use Power Up or Slash Mastery?

It depends. You should use Power Up if you are using a leader skill that gives increased Slash
Damage (Vettel, Zahar). You should use Slash Mastery if you are using a leader skill that gives
PATK (Shayna, Suzuka, Reimei). This is because the combination of both PATK and slash
damage is a greater modifier than one of the other. The math can be found here:
Should I use Rainbow/Element shards on xx unit?

written by /u/Ivyspear
These are the people who are worth sharding at any point in the game, not only in current JP meta.
 I’ll try to put them in the order of relevance, ie. in which they were introduced, if I know it:

Dark: Bashini | Aranea | Tsukuyomi | Sol | Teresa
Light: Zain | Zierva | Cor | Black Killer Tyrfing, | Nina
Fire: Laharl | Stock | Iris | Carla 
Water: Yauras (not yet) | Othima | Noctis
Thunder: Gilgamesh | Vier | Princess | Black Killer Laevateinn | Regis | Nigel | Gerald
Wind: Balt | Fate Yomi | Acht | Edward Elric | Parashu | Balt | Neferti

A good rule of thumb is the later in the list they are, the more relevant they are in JP now. 
One exception to this would be Laharl.

Now Gilgamesh in JP is arguably falling off. With the advent of the last 4 units I stated in the last 2 months, 
he’s no longer the King he once was. If JP gets an F/SN rerun, this might change, but there’s no guarantee
 of that. His base stats are just sad, and the “lightning nuker” niche is becoming saturated. But is he worth 
thunder sharding for now? Yes, it’ll be a long time before we see Nigel and co.

Fate Yomi lacks damage which is her main issue. However, she never gets “replaced” like 
Gilgamesh is, since her kit is so unique. At any rate, putting wind shards into her is a good idea.

I do not suggest dumping all your rainbow shards into either however. There are so many more 
good units who will come eventually, some sooner and some later. Don’t 
throw all your eggs into one basket.

Note from me: This mostly applies to the F2P to Dolphin crowd (basically everyone who only gets shards
from EX maps and Gumi giveaways). While this still does apply to whales, this is the most efficient list for
those who want to get the most out of their Rainbow/Elemental Shards. The most important thing to
remember is to play for your enjoyment right now. The future of this game, and this game in JP should not
affect what you do, if it affects your experience right now.
30% Slash ATK Leader Skill
50% PATK Leader Skill

Slash Mastery (10% Slash DMG)
100% + 30% + 10% = 140%

Slash Mastery (10% Slash DMG)
(100% + 10%) * 1.5 = 165%
Why are Basic Sniper, Basic Gunner, or Basic Hunter never recommended?

This is because of Charged Snipe, Charged Shot, and Wild Shot. The AI loves to use all three of these
skills on auto. Charged Snipe and Charged Shot have cast times, which means 75% of the time, the enemy
will just walk out of it, and it's a wasted turn. Wild Shot has a nice AoE, but the accuracy of the attack
is ~30%, meaning it will miss a large percentage of the time.
What's the difference between Job+ and JE?

A Job+ is a job improvement that only a single character will have. Although multiple units may have
the improvement for the same job, they will improve different skills and use different equipment,
farmable at different events. For example, Rahu and Lofia both have Chronomancer+, but Rahu's
Chronomancer+ improves her Overclock, while Lofia's improves her Black Hole. Rahu gets much more
AGI, and her Job+ Equipment can only be farmed during the Toy Box event, while Lofia has more MATK,
and her equipment can only be farmed during the Sweet Aspirations event.

JE, or Job Enchantments are not yet released on Global. There are a number of JEs for a job (so Holy
Cavalier will has Holy Cavalier[Pieta], Holy Cavalier[Izaya], and more). These job enchantments are
distributed to a group of characters who have that job, and are not made specifically for any character.

J+ require 6 special equipment at Job Level 11, while JE requires only the job-special equipment
which is a special varient found on JE maps that are permanent. E.G: Holy Cavalier[Pieta] uses
Pieta Armor instead of the Brilliant Wings Armor.

Machinist is a large-AoE ranged class. Main Machinist gives higher damage options with

being a very fast, highly mobile ninja with the ability to AoE, albeit smaller, when in range.
He can also run gunner to pinpoint enemies for CC.

jobs and play a role in most team comps.
Unfortunately needs level 66 to Bombshell first turn, but
is still very usable before that.

otherwise be impossible. Will eventually fall out of favor for better magic options.

from other jobs. Luckily for Ramses, he has access to Dark Cavalier J2, which gives him
Overdrive. Unfortunately, past that he does not have any other good passives (because
he runs sub Dark Cav, Jumper is useless). Move +1 is good to have, but not amazing.

Another wind attacker to add to our huge arsenal of
strong wind attackers. If you're lacking Wind-element,
he can get strong as early as J2, but otherwise
he won't bring much to the table.

Successor of the Sun
PATK +100
AGI +15

Magia Gunslinger has the luxury of being a ranged magic job that has no (only one) cast
times. This can prove valuable on some maps, but she will suffer from having OK damage.
She has great potential with a Magia Cleric Gun, where she can dish out decent amounts
of damage, while having a strong heal and cleanse.

Very valuable to have if you have a Magia Cleric Gun
because of her strong ranged leader skill, on top of
supportive capabilities.

Bibitto Kitaze
Range +2
Damage Against Wind +40%
AGI +10

Battle Mage is a defensive variant of a magic job, that comes with Drain Dimension,
which is a strong health drain, and also a 60% MATK buff. This helps out any magic
job that has armored mage (even in JP). Neica has the potential to be pretty tanky, with
Divine Shelter, and can still dish out a strong AoE hit.

Neica has a strong leader skill for units such as Zain
or Peridot. Battle Mage also helps out with her
survivability, and makes it so she can field when other
magic attackers are too squishy.

Super Magic
AGI +20
MATK +30
Reflection Value 20% -> 50%

A slow, low movement attacker with very few options to attack. Requires a lot of
support to help him, and even then uses a very unreliable attack method of jumps,
which can be easily avoided by moving. Requires a lot of investment for an alright
unit. On the bright side, he gives us a very good weapon.

A slow, low mobility unit that requires a flawed way of
attacking through jumps. Cadanova is usable because of
his fire PATK 50% leader skill. He requires heavy
investment for traits that are better in other attackers.

Flame Dragon God
A lot more damage and AGI

Kudanstein is usable at job 1, and gets better with each job unlocked. He is comparable to
Zangetsu who is one of the strongest "carries" currently. The difference is smaller AoEs,
no extra demon damage, and squishier rather than slower. And edgier. He is usable on his
own and brings great usage with his leader skill.

Ideally you want at least J2 for a very large PATK buff, and 
he can fill a role of a very solid dark attacker who doesn't
need much support.

A special Job 1 of Venom Archer. Her best job is her first and has access to various
versatile skills and CC from both her main and sub skillset. She gets a strong, cheap
diamond AoE that inflicts poison which will be extremely helpful on many maps. She also
has a very strong WA that helps her nuke.

She'll be a very solid ranged wind unit from J1. Her
later jobs give her more options but do not do much
overall in helping her damage.

Venom Archer+
Piercing attack replaced with a double hit,
higher multiplier attack that increases AGI

A Thunder tank with his own job of Power-Axe Knight. With his 50% PATK leader skill,
and some high multiplier attacks, Monzein will hit very hard..when he gets his turn.
Unfortunately, like all other tanks, he is still very slow, although he gets a passive
which increases his HP, making him a lot of tankier.

A good tank option to add to your list of other slow
tanks. Unlike the others, he will have more HP
(outside maybe Selena), and hits harder, but will be
tough to use effectively.

Power-Axe Knight
Replaces his defense buff with a strong nuke
that buffs his other stats by 100%.
Also increased base AGI.

Lord Commander is a pseudo-tank job that has access to various elemental attacks, and
a slash ATK up passive. He scales off .9 PATK and MATK, while both stats are very high,
meaning his damage is very high. Magic Swordsman and Holy Cavalier help 
turn the pseudo-tank into a full tank, while keeping his high damage.

Being a tank job, his AGI is mediocre on his J1. As a
result, he'll struggle a bit without the tankiness help
from J2 and J3, but he'll still have a good amount of
damage. Will shine at J2, and even moreso at J3.

Holy Cavalier [Gear]
AGI increasing reactive, new
skill that buffs AGI. More base AGI.
+50% additive power for Light Bringer

Twin-Blade Knight is similar to Twin-Blade Swordsman in that it has multiple multi-hit
attacks. Generally, these mean higher total multipliers, but Yauras has fairly low Combo
Multipliers leading to somewhat mediocre overall damage. She will play similarly to
Assassin Lamia, but scales fully off PATK, benefitting more off the Charge Up buff.

She will need J2 to get access to Charge Up to deal
damage, because her J1 does not give any damage
passives. She needs an extra turn to build up her
damage, which hurts her because she'll be squishy.

Twin-Blade Knight+
Higher AGI, more range, higher combo
multipliers (more overall damage)
E.G. Shiny Bubbles 120% -> 195% +2 Range

The nearly undisputed best unit on her release. With JP HP buffs given to her early, 
Selena, along with either her own 30% PATK leader skill, or either of two 50% water
PATK leader skills currently available is a very strong tank with 
very respectable damage. Very slow.

Released with HP buffs normally given later  Selena is
exceptionally tanky compared to all other tanks available. 
This, along with various options for water leader skills 
makes Selena the current best tank.

Yet another DK/DC unit, but with a ninja for job 2. This gives her some needed mobility, 
but does not fix her speed issues unless you run her as ninja. A difficult 
character to get to job 3 due to being a limited collaboration unit, so not worth the 
heavy investment when there are better DK/DC combinations for less of a cost.

As a Dark Knight/ Dark Cavalier unit, she can be used
with Dark Knight's PATK increase passives, but really
shines with Dark Cavalier. Works similarly to Suzuka.

Dark Cavalier+
Gives a lower cost Soul Sacrifice
Ninja [Kirin]
Huge speed increase at the cost of other stats.

A slow self-buffing attacker with access to the 2.5x
PATK boost of Martial Artist. Cita hits very hard if she gets in range. Pirate has access to a
larger AoE, but its water element removes Cita's advantage against
thunder foes, though removing the disadvantage against fire. Buffed later on.

A very strong unit. Hits very hard, is very tanky, and can 
self-buff. Her leader skill allows other wind units to have 
a lot more health, enhancing their survivability.

Holy Brawler [Shura]
Increases Sharpening Focus multiplier to 5x
 at the cost of reducing defenses to 0

Access to two very solid standalone jobs in Ranger and Holy Brawler. Shekinah is
flexible in the kind of team she can fit into. Basic Holy Brawler skills gives her a large
buff that can enhance the damage of her ranger abilities, allowing her to hit hard
from range.

Having two jobs that are very strong as standalone jobs,
Shekinah is capable of being flexible as either a ranged
or a melee attacker.

Ranger [Snake]
Remove enemy jewels
Holy Brawler [Maitreya]
Increase own jewels

Forcas functions as a more offensive Valkyrie. She has access to Pierce Mastery from
Spearman and her LS gives her pierce damage as well. Once she unlocks her J3, and has
her weapon equipped, Forcas has high damage potential, as well as a very strong single
target nuke on her 200% modifier WA.

She will be very usable from J1. Her
 lance gives her 8 more AGI and will be
very strong with Chrono support. Her lance
also gives a very strong WA, which is used with her J1

Holy Brawler [Maitreya]
3x3 cross heal and jewel regen

Bashosen is a J1 Machinist, has a J2 with mobility and Sniper J3. Wait where have
we heard this before. Bashosen functions as an inferior Albea. Her LS only applies to missile
damage, and she doesn't have the advantages that dark element has over wind. That said
she's still a very strong ranged unit, but is outclassed by a unit we already have.

She is still very good at all jobs. Machinist J1 gives a strong
ranged job from the start, and each subsequent job 
unlocked will make her better.

Ninja [Suzaku]
Increased jump mobility
Sniper [Barrel]
Longer range snipes at cost of movement

Sakura is a Blademaster J1. Considered a class even stronger than Holy Brawler, Blademaster
has high damage passives, strong long range AoEs, and good mobility. This, along with 
options of higher mobility from Ninja, and tankiness and damage from Warrior makes
Sakura a very strong unit to have. Her downfall comes from a lack of Charge Up/Sharpening

There is currently a bug (feature?) that makes
Sakura's Darkness Illumination give a 2.5x buff rather
than a 1.5x. This makes her very strong, somewhat
comparable to a future Blademaster who has Charge Up.

Ninja [Seiryu]
Gives damage to main status inflicting skills

Dark Princess Yomi has a first job ranger, but past that her other jobs don't have much
synergy. She can run Single Blade for more damage but loses a lot of the AGI that rangers
have. Her Merchant passives can give her more starting jewels, where when paired with
a Snowman Hat lets her WA first turn.

A decent ranged option from J1. Samurai gives her more
damage, but takes away AGI, and merchant has
supportive options, but none too essential.

SaberJ is an offensive job with tank options for her J2 and J3: as a result, SaberU lacks the
offensive backing that her J1 wants. SaberJ has 4 move, and has very good AGI, on top
of decent offensive abilities. She lacks decent passives; magic resistance gives 40% MDEF
to her 127 MDEF, Guard Up is bad, and Barrier is a mediocre passive locked behind J3.

She won't be awful to pull. She has potential with Saber
being a decent job and having good AGI: 119 at level 60,
but having multiple useful jobs is more useful than 
one useful job in the long run.

Jewel Magician is a strange job that has magic abilities on the main skillset, and physical
abilities on the subskill, despite being a job that has low PATK and DEX due to being a
mage-type. This means that her physical hits won't be dealing much damage without
using a turn to buff up. As a result, she will be best run as a full magic type attacker.

Rin is a very viable magic attacker, but a strange idea 
behind her job makes her lacking half of her possible 
kit. Suffers from having fire element on her abilities 
leading to the inability to break through water units.

Hero King is a very strong solo job, with a damage/AGI passive, a pre-emptive counter,
large, high damage AoEs, and 50% starting jewels. His later jobs enhance his first job even
more, giving him tanky options with Divine Shelter and making him ridiculously strong with
Overdrive. His only weakness comes from his double Thunder element attacks.

Very strong with J1, and shines with J3. He will be able
to be used on most maps, outside of Wind-majority
stages, and will stay viable for a long time to come.

Master Magician is a water-based magic job that has large AoEs and access to a 50% MATK
buff on its sub-skillset. With J3 and access to Swift Charge, as well as access to her WA,
with its insane 1.5x MATK scaling and physical properties, Illya's only weaknesses
are her 3 MOVE and susceptibility to physical attacks, and weakness to Thunder.

Illya will be very good J1 with access to self-buffs,
a strong WA and a natural strength against magic.
She suffers from low damage against Thunder, and
general squishiness, but is very strong otherwise.

Yomi is an incredibly flexible unit that can be run in many different ways, and is strong even
with J1. She can reach incredibly high AGI levels, especially with help from the J2 passive.
She has access to high damage ranged attacks, a strong buff, an HP drain which can fully
restore her health because it scales off PATK, and various versions of insta-cast stop.

She will be very useful J1, and very strong with J2. Her
J3 gives her access to various CC options that can
complement her high AGI very well.

Lamia's J1 suffers from the Wind Element added to her skills, negating any advantages that
she has over Fire. Her J2 plays a similar role to HBs, with a 3x PATK buff into a 150% mod
attack, but she suffers from her squishiness and relies heavily on evasion to do the same job
a Holy Brawler does, while they are tanky.

Can be very strong but suffers from sqiushiness on her J2.
Her J1 negates any elemental advanatages, and lacks
range and ranged AoEs to make up for it (such as in
Magnus' case)

Naturally high stats compared to his dark Archer counterpart Archer. Archer subskill
has a 40 cost 276% modifier attack in Twin-Blade Flurry. This, paired with Berserker's
naturally high stats makes him a fast, heavy hitter that also has access to regen and guts.
Requires Curious Doll for his J2 due to it's 0 starting jewels and jewel gain.

Can be very strong, and is very powerful J2. Suffers
from no jewel gain and gain, but can remedy this a little
with jewel obtained gear. J3 also has a nice self-quicken
which can be valuable in some cases.
4★ Unit Guide:
Zangetsu is the best "carry" currently available. His combination of Dragon
Cavalier's large AoE's, as well as Martial Artist's PATK boost allows him to be the
primary DPS on a team. Unfortunately, with single blade reducing AGI by 20%,
he requires many Chronomancers to effectively function, as he is really slow.

Usable with his first two jobs as a
slow fire attacker. Really shines at his J3
as an extra stage threat damage dealer

Dragon Cavalier [Rudra]
Gives a teleported Grand Cross

Her J+ is the strong job of Dragon Cavalier, but unfortunately for Lamia, her other
passives are very bad. Her Job+ gives her 2 more uses of Grand Cross, but does not
change the damage of it. Therefore, she'll be a solid water attacker, but frankly is
nothing special.

Can fit into early water teams but
eventually falls out of favor due to low speed. With J+,
she can fit into any water team, and with have
decent damage with a water leader.

Dragon Cavalier+
Access to the Dragon Cavalier job
with a 5 use Grand Cross rather than 3

Lofia with her Chrono+ is one of the better Chronomancers on GL, but does not compare
to her form in JP as a Chronomancer that takes hits. As a reference, at 85, Lofia with
her master ability hits 501 HP with 156 PDEF. This does not make her the tanky support
she is in JP with their 1.7K HP Lofia. She will take magic hits well though.

Can be run at any point as a magic tank.
One of the best Chronomancers at J3 because of
being tankier, and having faster casts with her
Swift Charge passive.

Chronomancer+
Reduces cost, increases multiplier, and
increases the cast speed of Black Hole

Sugar Boost
Auto Heal
PDEF +20
MDEF +20

Lucian shares his role as a Wind Holy Brawler with Yomi. While Yomi has high movement, 
Lucian has higher speed, and also has the option of opting into 
more health. Lucian may also function as a decent
wind damage dealer with his first job and basic second job and buffing with Charge Up.

Holy Brawlers are always viable.
Usable as a Beast Tamer assuming you
have J2, otherwise not really worth it
unless you're really dying for a wind unit

Holy Brawler+
Supreme Battle Trance becomes a
2x3 AoE on one side of Lucian

Megistos is the combination between the worst ranged jobs. This, alongside the lack of
synergy with Bishop makes for a trainwreck of a unit. There are much better Bishops
available, and the single ranged passive leads to a fairly low range ranged unit. 
Edgar is a better choice if in need of a ranged unit.

Machinist+
Bombshell is a lightning element magic
AoE that reduces speed for enemies hit

Having access to Sniper+, as well as a strong ranged leader skill makes Caris one of the
better ranged units. Her slow on her sniper+ makes her extremely effective against melee
units. Can be run as a gunner with pinpoint for CC.

A very strong sniper because of high base
stats and access to double range and
increased AGI. Can be run as a fast
gunner to Pinpoint Shot an enemy

Sniper+
Piercing Snipe multiplier increased and
inflicts slow on enemies hit

A Chronomancer as Job 1, she is usable as a support when pulled. Her later jobs increase
her versatility, and her Chronomancer+ makes her the fastest Chronomancer in the game.
Her Overclock speed and general AGI will be unmatched and her healing capabilities
make her a support that can fit into any team.

A strong support from J1 that gets better with each
job unlocked. Becomes much faster with her J+ and can
give turns and help increase the tempo of your team
much better than other Chronomancers.

Chronomancer+
Faster AGI and faster cast Overclock
Zero Enchanter
Buff dispelling

Hazuki is another unit with no synergies between her jobs. Mage wants support from 
other jobs to help cast speed or improve their movement. Professor is a defensive
 support class with no cast times, and enchanter is best used for a passive that 
reduces cast times. She can be used as a Professor with slightly better heals but is not ideal.

You run her if you don't have Elizabeth
and need a Professor. Otherwise fairly
useless.

Professor [Aid]
Increased potency on heals of professor
Tender Wind Enchanter
Wind Element Buffs

Chihaya is the fastest Chronomancer outside of Rahu's Job+. This allows her to have a
slight advantage in terms of casts, outside of those with the Swift Charge passive. Her
Dancer can be run to debuff enemies, although it's generally better to run enchanters
or chronomancers as support.

Very good if you get her to Chronomancer
If you want, you can run her as dancer but
usually not worth the spot that she takes.

Dancer+
Map wide 20% enemy stat decrease

Dilga is one of a few Thunder tanks. In his current state he is not very tanky. He has
the worse of the two tank jobs, but in the future he will receive Holy Cavalier+. This
allows him to fill a certain niche where Thunder tanks are needed. He also has more 
damage than some tanks with Martial Artist, but some are still superior. Also slow.

Right now does not work too well. Can
potentially output more damage than
other tanks but he's very slow and
does not have a good tanking job.

Holy Cavalier+
Light Bringer increases PDEF by 15%

Mia right now can function as the leader of mage teams with her 20% MATK LS. 
She can work as a magic attacker with ninja stealth to boost her move, but mage is a very
bad job with low range and lower damage compared to sages. Can be run as a higher
mobility Bishop with better heals.

Has the best leader skill for magic team
compositions. Has decent mobility for
a mage but lacks enchanter which makes
them strong. Usable magic attacker.

Sage+
Poison Mist inflicts damage, root and skill lock
Ninja [Byakko]
Increases evasion

Reagan can be described with the idiom "jack of all trades, master of none." Reagan 
has 3 unrelated classes that can be used to create a sort of support sniper. 
He is currently a good unit, due to being a sniper, but will fall off due to
inflexibility. Can double assault burst with time leap.

A standalone sniper job is very strong.
The basic abilities of sniper are very
weak which means Reagan becomes a
supportive sniper with Chemist and Chrono Basic.

Sniper [Barrel]
Focused on longer range snipes at the
cost of movement and close-range

Melda has a niche role of being a 5-move Beast Tamer. This allows her to be run with
certain Roar cheese compositions for Extra stages. She can also run Single Blade
and with a Fire Leader Skills can deal a respectable amount of damage.

Can use roar to prevent skills from being cast on
certain EX maps (Demonic Spearman EX most notably).
Needs a fire leader skill, like Reimei, to be able to deal
damage

Reida is one of the only units that can be run as primary Shrine Maiden
and not be a liability. Her Shrine Maiden buff can allow her MATK to 
reach very high levels and she becomes fast and fairly tanky. Can also
be run as a full sage if needed, but loses the advantage she has over other magic dealers.

Viable once she gets her J2 unlocked. Can fill the role
of magic attacker on any team. Becomes much stronger
with the Shrine Maiden weapon Oracle's Prayer

Ninja [Kirin]
Huge speed increase at the cost of other stats

Vincent has his first job as Sage which makes him usable from J1. Unlike the other sages,
his other jobs do not provide anything in terms of offensive power for his sage, but
the job is fine standalone. With his Poison Knowledge from Professor, he is better at
poisoning than others, but it's usually better to just cast damaging spells.

Automatically has some usage because of his sage
job. His other classes do not provide much help
to his damage. If you want to run him as a support
you can, but there are much better options.

Professor [Mad]
Empowering and Energy Potion
buffs more

Works exactly the same as Rahu's Bishop/Chronomancer combination, but needs
J3. As such, it's easier to use Rahu, and Rahu is future proofed with her J+, while Celine
has yet to receive anything. Can have Magic Up+1 from mage to increase her healing
but it's for the most part irrelevant.

If you have her J3 and don't have Rahu J2, you can use
her, but Rahu is better than her in all other situations.

Strie currently has a few options, but none of them are too strong individually. Courage can
fulfill her role as ranged fire unit better, while only needing J1.

Not really but gets a fairly good Job+ for a job not yet 
released in the future so worth keeping around.

Assassin+
Gold version of Thief
Better Assassin-Blade Charm

Has the job setup to become a discount Zangetsu, but Dragon Knight does not have
access to the strong AoE that Dragon Cavalier has, so Freed falls short.
More worth it once he gets Dragon Cavalier, but does not have a 50% PATK passive
to increase his damage, so will always be in Zangetsu's shadow.

No, but with his Dragon Cavalier+ he'll be much more
usable

Dragon Cavalier+
Dragon Slayer increased multiplier and
AGI increase

Having first job sniper means Courage will be usable from J1. Her second job of crafter
gives her more AGI, while her third job of dark knight gives her access to Overlimit which
gives her more damage potential. She can be the highest damage output sniper if equipped
with both damage passives, but at the loss of 2 range.

Snipers are currently one of the best ranged jobs. 
Access to Sniper J1, as well as being one of the first good
fire ranged units lets her be a strong addition to most teams.
Damage increase: Shot Mastery - 20%, Overlimit - 17.5%

Sniper [Scope]
Can give herself a 2.5x damage boost
and has an exact 5 range cardinal 
high damage ability

With Holy Cavalier J1, Victor will be usable right from the start. Unlocking his ninja will
give him much more mobility that tanks generally lack. His J3 does not give him much in
terms of boons but can help him with his evasion (but he's a tank). He'll be a unit that won't
be bad to pull, but is generally just solid, rather than strong.

Can be used as a tank option but has somewhat
lower stats due to being a base 4*. Shines more
as a higher mobility tank but still slow.

Holy Cavalier [Magi]
Anti-magic
Ninja [Kirin]
Huge speed increase at the cost of other stats

The original concept of J1 Machinist that we haven't seen 3 times already. Carol is in a way
the inferior version of Albea, Bashosen, Hazel because of her lower stats due to being
a base 4*, as well as having one range +1 from Hunter. Her niche is being able to
get enough starting jewels to Dynamic Buster Bomb first turn, but that isn't necessary often.

Usable as a Job 1 Machinist that is slightly easier
to get than the others due to being a 4*. Eventually
will want to be run as Merchant because of her Job+

A late arriver, bringing us 2 jobs good for their subskill and passive, but not for their main.
This leaves us with Hunter, which quite frankly makes for an awful unit if that's your
best option. Discount Shekinah, and by discount, I mean you find Hayate at the dollar store
and Shekinah is $300 in some boutique.

At the point of Global he was released, he will be an
absolutely awful investment. Hunter was not a good job 
on launch, and is even worse now. His attacks have more
setup than other ranged units for similar damage.

Soleil is a Sage, but runs a more supportive playstyle. Her job setup is similar to Fung, but
having Bishop means she can get rid of the somewhat redundant subset of Sage, and
run sub Bishop, which gives her healing. Magic Barrier and Swift Charge are great tools to 
help her defensively, and help her cast her offensive and supportive spells faster.

Will need at least J2 to be any different from the
other Sages. Having both Sage and Bishop allows you
to run a somewhat supportive Sage without giving
up anything important.

Glanz has the same setup as Suzuka, in a different order, but what she lacks is a 50%
PATK leader skill, and 5* stats. Her setup mimics both Suzuka and Laevateinn, but her
stats are slightly worse than Laev. She can fulfill a fast first turn nuker, but similar to
Laevateinn, she doesn't hit nearly as hard as Suzuka.

She joins a large cast of squishy glass cannon dark
units, but her role is outclassed by both Suzuka and
Laevateinn, and seeing as they have dark element
on Ret Blade, will still be used regardless of element
1★-3★ Unit Guide:
A unit given for free at the start. Fufills a somewhat more mobile tank. Can be used on early
stages but will lack the needed tank stats for later maps. Getting hit increases AGI which
addresses low AGI issues.

Can be used early on but ideally replaced with better
tanks or ranged units for story progression.

Holy Cavalier [Porta]
Focuses on pierce resistance

A unit given for free at the start. Best used as a bard for more HP, AGI and MOVE.
Can have options to heal with sub priest but best suited for team buffing with sub bard.

Not ideal but can fill the role of support/healer until
better options are obtained.

Professor [Honey]
Specializes in charm and lockdown

The fastest Professor outside of Lucretia. He's is your best option if you need a Professor
main and sub. He has mobility options and is slightly tankier due to Guard Up. Being a
farmable unit means he is able to get higher levels and will be stronger than Professors
limited by LBs.

A Professor often overlooked, but is a lot faster and
tankier than other options such as Elizabeth. Lacks
versatility but can do his single job well.

A bishop that has access to increased MATK from Mage, as well as increased speed
from crafter. Annerose will be the fastest Bishop we currently have available, which 
can help her function well as an offensive damage dealer.
Not really unless you really need a healer.

A six move ninja. Highest base mobility gives Mizuchi a niche role with easy access
to enemies with a 3 ranged attack.  Ninja is a decent standalone job with elemental
coverage. Can also be run as a high mobility hunter.

Vanekis has access to a variety of passives that all can synergize well with
her ability as a mage. Thief can help her issue with movement while enchanter 
helps her cast speed with Swift Charge, as well as giving her a 3 move, tankier 
magic job as a main. Gets Sage+ later.

One of the best mages available
Unfortunately Mage is a bad job outclassed by Sage.
Usable as a magic unit with all jobs unlocked

Sage+
Mega Spark inflicts PATK, MATK, AGI -40%
Roaring Thunder Enchanter
Thunder Element Buffs

A budget wind damage dealer. Having martial artist as a job already opens up many
possibilties for being a decent damage dealer. A 2.5x PATK buff can make any unit
hit at least decently. Can fill the role of a wind attacker if your team is lacking.
Also works as a chest grabber.

A good beginner wind attacker. At job 3 he is
comparable to wind-attackers such as Balt or Yomi
who have not unlocked J3 or J2, respectively

Ninja [Genbu]
Gives him more mobility and a teleport

The double range passive works similarly to that of Edgar, which allows Elaine to work
as a mediocre psuedo-sniper. Can currently fill a niche role of a ranged unit, but
should be replaced with any other unit.
Can fulfill use as a ranged attacker but easily outclassed

Having access to sniper as her third job, as well as another range passive in hunter,
and feral kid in beast tamer gives Almira a solid set of passives to allow her to thrive
as a sniper. Also is a 3*, which makes it easy to obtain her LBs.

Considered one of the best snipers alongside
Caris. Access to double range passives as 
well as an AGI boosting passive gives versatility.
Favorable element over Caris and Magnus

Sniper [Scope]
Can give herself a 2.5x damage boost
and has an exact 5 range cardinal 
high damage ability

Michael is an example of a joke unit being 
given a joke job. Professor+ gives him access to an AoE poison, which itself is a weak
status effect. He can fulfill his role as a Professor well, but other Professors are easier
to access. Chronomancer is a solid standalone job, but his Chrono is on the weaker side.

Professor+ does not give him much AGI, which is
what professors value the most as a stat (outsped by
Gane and Lucretia). His J+ ability is strong, but
Professors aren't damage dealers.

Professor+
5x5 water AoE that inflicts Poison

The pairing of main job Bishop and sub Bard allows Alyu to be a fairly well rounded 
support that can both heal, buff, and damage. Chemist doesn't bring anything to the
 table that Alyu would want, but the job combination from her first two jobs is sufficient.

Not really unless you need a healer. Becomes stronger
in the future because of her JE and Bard combination.

Professor [Mad]
Empowering and Energy Potion
buffs more

The best bard because she is both farmable, and sustainable in the long run, due to
Bard+. Helpful in apple farms to reach certain PATK or MATK thresholds to one shot
rattys. Her Bard+ is the best at clearing low level maps, because of its 150 map-wide
AoE.

The best at clearing low level maps, but struggles a bit
for harder maps because of her lack of damage. Can be
used as a buffer, but generally you don't want to give
up a spot for a bard.

Bard+
Gets a map wide DMG AoE that inflicts sleep.
Free Unit Guide:
First protagonist. Starts off with 60% starting jewels which allows him to be a bit
better than other Holy Knights. Gets a Holy Cavalier+ later on which makes him
a very solid tank.

Holy Cavalier+
PATK buff on Light Bringer. 40% PDEF
passive

Second protagonist. Starts off with 60% starting jewels, which allows him to be a bit
better than other Dark Knights. Very good on maps where enemies have very high
defense. Gets Dark Cavalier+ later on but it doesn't make him good.

Dark Cavalier+
Dark Saber increases PDEF, self heal,
HP cost down with HP increase

An early farmable fire healer. Not very useful, other bishops are more flexible and
have more to bring than just healing. Can function as a fire magic attacker with
coverage from sub mage.
Usable if you need a healer

A fast Twin-Blade  swordsman that relies on evasion for survivability. Has fairly low 
damage due to lack of ATK modifiers like Dark Cavalier or Martial Artist. Relies
heavily on team support or Thunder leader skills.

A Dark Knight/ Dark Cavalier unit hiding behind a job that sounds like it's unrelated. 
Similar to other units of its kinda, works as a slow glass cannon and works best
with Chronomancer supports or on maps where enemies don't do damage (apple 
farms).

Heavily relies on his Dirk of Projection and Armor of Wrath to be viable. Requires
a heavy amount of investment for a thief. Can be considered a joke alongside Zahar, 
the other unit that can equip Armor of Wrath, as it makes light units irrelevant against
them.

Yes if you have his weapon. Even more so
if you have his armor

Ranger [Hawk]
Based around evasion
Assassin [Night]
Status Ailment Control

Drifter is a Thunder-based gunner clone. With double range passives, Edgar can
function as a pseudo-sniper with a heavy advantage over water foes. There is no
difference between Revenge and Counter Shot reactives.

Can work as a pseudo-sniper when running
double ranged passives. Strong against
water-units due to Thunder element of the
job but very weak to wind.

Drifter+
Piercing Shot has chance to crit
and increases crit rate

With her double slash ATK passives, she has very high damage output, and she has flexibility
in that she can raise her own Dark Res, as well as allies. Her headdress ability gives allies
all elemental resistance allowing her to make allies tankier.

Running double slash ATK passives gives her 50%
increased damage which is the highest out of light damage
dealers outside of Suzuka J3. She also has high dark
resistance to counteract her Light element.

A unit that relies very heavily on her weapon, and future buffs. Currently can be viewed
as a more free version of a free unit: Chloe. Once she receives her
buffs she becomes a top tier unit.

Usable as a tank, but is comparable to Logi
in her current state. Will become much
better later.

Holy Cavalier [Gear]
AGI increasing reactive, new
skill that buffs AGI. More base AGI.
+50% additive power for Light Bringer

The best of the free units. She brings high damage and a good arrangement of
jobs. Her Twin-Blade provides the agility and versatile skillset that allows her to do a
lot of damage with Overdrive from Dark Cavalier. Unfortunately cannot use her
weapon as it's for Dark Cavalier and she doesn't run it as her main.

Will be the best free unit released at this
point. Capable of doing a lot of damage
and being very fast.

Dark Cavalier [Faust]
High HP cost abilities

Blaze Orb Princess is a big upgrade for Kagura. It removes her fixed passive of Heat
Haze when she only has her J2, and gives her a diamond AoE on her main. She will
still suffer from low HP, but has decent AGI and can fulfill her job as a mage with a
defensive accessory, because both her passives are damage boosting.

A good fire mage that will excel on maps with mainly
wind enemies. Suffers from low HP, but has many
party buffs that can help her take more hits, and
has a high damage hit with her WA.

Scorching Jewel Princess+
Blazing Vortex damage increase

The reverse Shenmei, Veloz gets his only usable job at J3, while Crafter and Thief
take his J1 and J2 spots. Unfortunately, Bridesgroom is an OK unit by itself, and
all Crafter and Thief provide is a small AGI increase and a Move +1 passive.
Not the best investment, but he's free.

What seems like a good combination is quickly tarnished by very lackluster stats across the
board. As a ranger, Milis is very slow, having AGI that could be comparable to Zangetsu (who
loses 20% of his AGI running Single Blade). Her PATK and DEX are lower than Seida's when
Seida is 60 and Milis is 85, and Almira at 75 will do more damage than her at 85.

Usable if you're lacking a wind bow-user. Can see 
arguments for use alongside Almira, due to varying ranged 
classes but completely outclassed by Seida, even at max 
level.

Despite being called Archer, as a job, it's a melee job that uses Twin-Swords that has
ranged attacks that cost jewels. As a result it's fairly difficult to best take advantage of the
various ranged passives that Archer has access to, and as a result it's best to run him
as a +3 range Ranger with some of the Archer passives.

Not a bad Ranger. Much better in terms of AGI
compared to Milis and his dark element means he has
no elemental disadvantages on the offensive side. Easy
to farm so quick to get 85.

With access to both Dark Cavalier and Holy Cavalier, Zeke will be able to be a decent
damage dealer while still having Holy Cavalier's high base PDEF, with a 15% net gain
for PDEF with both passives. He is gated by low AGI and MOVE, but his AGI will still be 
higher than all other Holy Cavaliers at this moment, outside of Vettel with MA.

He will be much stronger than all other Holy Cavaliers at
this time. He takes the tankiness of Holy Cavalier and
high damage of Dark Cavalier, and creates a hybrid that
is fairly well-rounded.

Peridot is a nice farmable Sage, which can fulfill the need for magic on team, because her
element doesn't give her any large weaknesses in terms of offense (advantage against
all elements other than light. What Peridot does lack though, is good base stats, and
help for her Sage. Mage and Thief are bronze classes which provide very little.

Can be used if you need some magic damage.
Very low MATK, and mediocre AGI means she will
be easily outclassed by other Sages and magic
damage dealers.

Lisbeth is our fourth protagonist, and has a strong supportive skillset that can be
valuable even outside of story. Her HP is high for a magic user, and her defenses are
in a good spot, so she won't be nearly as squishy as other healers or professors.

A good farmable support unit. Has strong potential
in the future so is a great investment to make right now.

Wizard+
Jewel Flip gives 6 more jewels and gives
the target PATK, MATK +30% for 3 turns

Having a free merchant is nice, but statwise, because she has a free unit's stats, at 85,
she is comparable to a 65 Aruba. What she can run though, is 3 gear slots, which puts
slightly above Aruba for general use, and having a merchant for water-element is always
good.
Aswald Detailed Breakdown:
Aswald
Unit Detail:
Job 1: Shadow Assassin
Job 2: Twin-Blade Swordsman
Job 3: Gunner

Leader Skill:
Dark - 40% PATK | 5% Evasion

Before talking about Aswald and her pros and cons, it’s important to first understand the Assassin job, and what it brings.

Assassin is a 4 move, 4 jump, high agility DPS. It specializes in various forms of ranged CC, as well as high damage, defense ignoring backstabs. What assassin lacks is strong ranged damage and survivability, having somewhat low HP with little defensive options.

Main Job: Assassin
The primary choices for her main job are between Assassin and Twin-Blade Swordsman. Gunner, while useful for the ability to Pinpoint Shot for the stop status effect is not a reliable choice otherwise. There are a few things to compare when talking about Assassin and Twin-Blade Swordsman. Both have their strength being high AGI DPS that have inconsistent defensive options. Twin-Blade Swordsman has more passive evasion with Feint and Perfect Evasion, while Assassin has evasion in Air Surge on their main skillset.

In terms of damage options, Assassin has most significantly Soul Slicer which is a 200% modifier (250% to humans) attack that ignores defense if used with a backstab. It also increases her AGI by 80% for one turn. Air Surge is a 5x5 125% modifier diamond AoE around herself that increases evasion by 50% for one turn.

Twin-Blade Swordsman in comparison has their most significant ability in Bladestorm, a 4 range straight line single target ranged attack, and has a 3x3 110% modifier cross around herself as their AoE option in Spinslash.

Comparing these two, it’s evident that Assassin has higher damage potential. Although its costs are higher and has no range, Assassin has two defense ignoring attacks, and can increase their own AGI significantly, which can help them get more turns than Twin-Blade Swordsman.

The last thing of note between these two jobs is their mobility. Assassin has 4 move and 4 jump, while Twin-Blade Swordsman only has 3 move and 2 jump. Aswald’s Assassin also has higher AGI than her Twin-Blade Swordsman. Both jobs being of the high AGI squishy DPS types, Assassin has a much more reliable way of surviving, with buff options on her main skills which are of much more significance than Twin-Blade Swordsman and their damage-only main skillset.

Basic Ability: Basic Assassination
The competition for basic ability is not nearly as debatable as main job. Basic Assassin gives three range dagger throws that inflict various CC: Poison, Blind, Paralysis, Sleep, and Charm. 

Basic Twin-Blade Swordsman gives a “blind” on a low damage one range skill, self buffs for evasion and PATK (insignificant buff), and a 100% modifier evasion skill with high cost.

Basic Gunner shouldn’t be considered even on ranged units.

Reactive: Perfect Evasion
Assassin’s reactive Stance of the Runner gives a 50% chance to increase their own CT by 40 when hit (4/10 of the CT required for a turn). At first it seems like a good reactive for Assassin, who is somewhat of a tempo-focused job. The flaws behind this though are that Assassin is already fairly squishy. This reactive is counter-intuitive in the way Assassin wants to be played, with their AoE skill on their main skillset giving high evasion chance. The reactive does not proc if they are not hit, but if they are hit, their evasion efforts are wasted.

As a result, Perfect Evasion, which gives a 10% chance to evade physical attacks is a much better choice for their playstyle. 

Passive 1: Stealth
Each job of of Aswald has one passive, meaning she has 2 of 3 choices to select. Stealth gives her Move +1 and Jump +1, which is a very reliable passive that helps with the style that Assassin wants to be played of maneuvering to key targets with a high damage defense ignoring attack, then running out of range from retaliation. 

Passive 2: Range +1 or Feint
The second passive is the interchangable. Feint increases her evasion, which helps with survivability, but is very RNG-based. Range +1 increase the range that she can throw her CC daggers, and can be very significant in reaching important enemies, but may not always be necessary.
